feature.name: copy-personalized-comments
feature.title: Copy Personalized Comments to Another Subject
feature.description: Add functionality to copy personalized comments from one subject to another via a modal interface with overwrite/append options

complexity.reasoning: Simple frontend feature with straightforward API integration. 4-5 user stories, single developer, 1-2 weeks effort. New modal component, dropdown subject selection, radio button for overwrite/append mode, and API integration via existing endpoint.

planning.notes: PRD, user stories, and acceptance criteria completed. Feature ready for implementation.

design.notes: L1 complexity - no formal architecture document required. Design system patterns to be followed.

implementation.notes: All 5 user stories (US-CP-001 through US-CP-005) implemented with TDD methodology. CopyCommentsModal component created with full prop integration through component hierarchy. API integration complete with error handling and success feedback.

validation.notes: All tests passing: 70 CopyCommentsModal tests + 1563 total suite tests. Build succeeds. Integration tests verify ownedSubjects prop flows correctly through SubjectList → SubjectListItem → PersonalizedCommentsModal → CopyCommentsModal.

businessValue.userImpact: Teachers can efficiently reuse personalized comments across multiple subjects, reducing duplicate effort and ensuring consistency in feedback across classes

deliverables: Full error handling and success feedback
